summary.para: Sets the spatial audio directivity model for the .

param.name: directivity
param.para: The spatial audio directivity model. This value can be one of the following structures:

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects was not called before the call to SetDirectivity.

SetEndOfStream was called either explicitly or implicitly in a previous audio processing pass. SetEndOfStream is called implicitly by the system if GetBuffer is not called within an audio processing pass (between calls to ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects and ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.EndUpdatingAudioObjects).

remarks.para: The structure represents an omnidirectional model that can be linearly interpolated with a cardioid or cone model.
If SetDirectivity is not called, the default type of is used with no interpolation.

SetEndOfStream is called implicitly by the system if GetBuffer is not called within an audio processing pass (between calls to ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects and ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.EndUpdatingAudioObjects).

remarks.para: If SetEnvironment is not called, the default values are used.

param.name: gain
param.para: The gain for the in dB.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects was not called before the call to SetGain.

SetEndOfStream was called either explicitly or implicitly in a previous audio processing pass. SetEndOfStream is called implicitly by the system if GetBuffer is not called within an audio processing pass (between calls to ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects and ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.EndUpdatingAudioObjects).

remarks.para: This is valid only for spatial audio objects configured to use the decay type. Set the decay type of an object by calling . Set the default decay type for an all objects in an HRTF render stream by setting the DistanceDecay field of the passed into .
If SetGain is never called, the default value of 0.0 is used. After SetGain is called, the gain that is set will be used for the audio object until the gain is changed with another call to SetGain.

summary.para: Sets the orientation in 3D space, relative to the listener's frame of reference, from which the audio data will be rendered.

param.name: orientation
param.para: An array of floats defining row-major 3x3 rotation matrix.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects was not called before the call to SetOrientation.

SetEndOfStream was called either explicitly or implicitly in a previous audio processing pass. SetEndOfStream is called implicitly by the system if GetBuffer is not called within an audio processing pass (between calls to ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects and ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.EndUpdatingAudioObjects).

remarks.para: If SetOrientation is never called, the default value of an identity matrix is used. After SetOrientation is called, the orientation that is set will be used for the audio object until the orientation is changed with another call to SetOrientation.

summary.para: Sets the position in 3D space, relative to the listener, from which the audio data will be rendered.

param.name: x
param.para: The x position of the audio object, in meters, relative to the listener. Positive values are to the right of the listener and negative values are to the left.

param.name: y
param.para: The y position of the audio object, in meters, relative to the listener. Positive values are above the listener and negative values are below.

param.name: z
param.para: The z position of the audio object, in meters, relative to the listener. Positive values are behind the listener and negative values are in front.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects was not called before the call to SetPosition.

SetEndOfStream was called either explicitly or implicitly in a previous audio processing pass. SetEndOfStream is called implicitly by the system if GetBuffer is not called within an audio processing pass (between calls to ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects and ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.EndUpdatingAudioObjects).
The is not of type AudioObjectType_Dynamic. Set the type of the audio object with the type parameter to the method.

remarks.para: This method can only be called on a that is of type AudioObjectType_Dynamic. Set the type of the audio object with the type parameter to the method.

Position values use a right-handed Cartesian coordinate system, where each unit represents 1 meter. The coordinate system is relative to the listener where the origin (x=0.0, y=0.0, z=0.0) represents the center point between the listener's ears.

If SetPosition is never called, the origin (x=0.0, y=0.0, z=0.0) is used as the default position. After SetPosition is called, the position that is set will be used for the audio object until the position is changed with another call to SetPosition.

summary.para: Represents an object that provides audio data to be rendered from a position in 3D space, relative to the user, a head-relative transfer function (HRTF). Spatial audio objects can be static or dynamic, which you specify with the type parameter to the method. Dynamic audio objects can be placed in an arbitrary position in space and can be moved over time. Static audio objects are assigned to one or more channels, defined in the enumeration, that each correlate to a fixed speaker location that may be a physical or a virtualized speaker
This interface is a part of Windows Sonic, Microsoft’s audio platform for more immersive audio which includes integrated spatial sound on Xbox and Windows.

remarks.para: Note Many of the methods provided by this interface are implemented in the inherited interface.
